entry.title: Request update due to `HttpsUpgrades` feature are not paused by Fetch interception
entry.content:
Chrome introduces the `HttpsUpgrades` feature https://chromestatus.com/feature/6056181032812544. The such update request are reported by the CDP Network domain but remain not intercepted by the Fetch domain. This creates an issue that such request can't intercepted and also that these there is no way to differentiate them from a normal request.
Which from our understanding is happening around https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:net/url_request/url_request_job.cc;l=181;drc=11c6fee8868a670b11ae04cf5649f7805f6cc16a https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ssl/https_upgrades_interceptor.h;drc=fe132eeb21687c455d695d6af346f15454828d01
A link to the CDP logs from Puppeteer that show the behavior https://gist.github.com/Lightning00Blade/e88e7b7aa8cd332a8fc0ee5e6fda57db Line 18 and Line 21 have the event, but only a single `Fetch.requestPaused` is emitted after. Related Puppeteer issue

entry.title: GPU rasterize breaks page layout on some devices using chrome, manually disabling rasterize fixes it
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Use one of this configuration : Samsung Galaxy A34 / Chrome V123.0.6312.40 Oppo A 78 / Chrome V123.0.6312.40 Xiaomi Redmi Note 12 Pro / Chrome V123.0.6312.40 Realme 11X 5G Chrome V123.0.6312.40 Oppo CPH 2371 / Chrome V122.0.62.61.105 2. Go to this address : https://www.cdiscount.com/search/10/toile+tonnelle.html or https://fr.shopping.rakuten.com/search/converse 3. Scroll up/down 4 Display is broken
# Problem Description Divs are overlapping each other, if GPU Rasterization is disabled, the webpage is displayed correctly.
# Additional Comments Gpu rasterization has been previously subject to fixes in v119 : https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40948679
# Summary GPU rasterize breaks page layout on some devices using chrome, manually disabling rasterize fixes it
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Heap Layout Tool Stops working
entry.content:
https://v8.github.io/tools/head/heap-layout/index.html
Loading a v8.log file generated by `--trace-gc-heap-layout` causes errors:
``` drawChart @ heap-layout-viewer.mjs:151 stateChanged @ heap-layout-viewer.mjs:48 set data @ heap-layout-viewer.mjs:32 globalDataChanged @ index.html:34 onchange @ index.html:64 handleLoadEnd @ trace-file-reader.mjs:104 (anonymous) @ trace-file-reader.mjs:94 asyncReadFile @ web-api-helper.mjs:148 await in asyncReadFile (async) (anonymous) @ web-api-helper.mjs:136 requestAnimationFrame (async) readFile @ web-api-helper.mjs:136 handleChange @ web-api-helper.mjs:86 ```

entry.title: Cancel array buffer sweeping instead of finalizing (when possible)
entry.content:
The array buffer sweeper is using a cancelable task for background sweeping. This task cannot be interrupted and can only be cancelled if it hasn't already started.
In some cases, we could cancel array buffer sweeping instead of finishing it prior to starting a new GC (specifically, when we know all array buffer are promoted).
Before we can cancel sweeping, we need to be able interrupt a running array buffer sweeping task. To do end, we will refactor the array buffer sweeper to use the jobs api and yield when needed.

stderr:mktemp: Failed to create directory datalocaltmpcb_run_results.hfcZhl2xBJG: Read-only file system ```

entry.title: Apple Silicon: 2D canvas hardware acceleration bug with source-in globalCompositeOperation
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open https://orgpad-test.uk/o/A5bOeYhJBBnLZ6sfEC4-dH. 2. After loading, switch to another tab and switch back.
Happens on both Apple Macbook Pro M1 and Apple Macbook Air M2, Mac OS 14.1.2.
Screenshots are correct rendering and broken one are displayed in the page. Turning off hardware acceleration of 2D canvas rendering fixes the problem.
# Problem Description The rendering is done into a memory canvas, from which is it drawn onto the screen canvas. When zooming enough, it switches to rendering directly into the screen canvas which works fine. The rendering code is the following:
(doto ctx ;; clears the space for the title text (draw/clear-rect! cleared-corner cleared-size) ;; clips the cleared space to avoid changes outside (draw/save!) (draw/begin-path!) (draw/rect! cleared-corner cleared-size) (draw/clip!) ;; renders the black uncolored letters from the letter atlas (render-atlas-letters! title-letters letters canvas canvas-zoom nil top-center-pixel zoom) ;; draws title-color on top of black letters (draw/set-composite-operation! "source-in") (draw/begin-path!) (draw/set-fill-style! title-color) (draw/rect! cleared-corner cleared-size) (draw/fill!) ;; draws search matches and bg-color below the colored letters (draw/set-composite-operation! "destination-over") (render-search-matches! search-matches color top-left-pixel zoom) (draw/begin-path!) (draw/set-fill-style! bg-color) (draw/rect! cleared-corner cleared-size) (draw/fill!) ;; draws the colored letters from the letter atlas (e.g. emojis) (draw/set-composite-operation! "source-over") (render-atlas-letters! title-letters letters canvas canvas-zoom true top-center-pixel zoom) ;; unclips the cleared space (draw/restore!))
This is a trivial Clojurescript wrapper for CanvasRenderingContext2D methods. It copies letters from another canvas, then draws title-color over them and then adds background color behind them.
The problem started occuring only couple version of Chrome back.
# Summary Apple Silicon: 2D canvas hardware acceleration bug with source-in globalCompositeOperation
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: HSL color picker defaults to "Hue: 0" when saturation is set to 0
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 124.0.6367.61 (Official Build) (arm64) OS : 14.4.1 (23E224)
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open DevTools and inspect any element with a color assigned to it (you can use this demo site: https://peters-css-playground.glitch.me/experiments/color-tester.html) 2. In the Elements > Styles tab, click on the color swatch and select "HSL" as the color mode 3. Set the saturation to zero
What is the expected result? The value for "hue" is kept the same
What happens instead? 1. The preview switches to a red color palette (hue 0), see video 1 2. When dragging the hue slider, the value is always kept at 0, see video 2

entry.title: Since March the last three chromeos updates were each approx. 1,7GB in size.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. I just get the system pop-up that an update is available. When I click on it the system tells me that I'm on a metered connection and whether I want to go ahead and tells the update size. 2. 3.
# Problem Description Since March the last three chromeos updates I received were each approx. 1,7GB in size. This amounts to 3,4GB a month. For anyone on a metered connection (like me) this uses a lot of the data plan. Is this a bug or a permanent change? Before, I received smaller ones of around 50-70MB and from time to time a bigger one with definitely less than 1GB.
# Summary Since March the last three chromeos updates were each approx. 1,7GB in size.
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Regression: Bookmarks and edit buttons overlap in right topmost corner on chrome mac and linux in exit full screen mode
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 125.0.6423.0 (Official Build) canary (x86_64) f2983f361cae3033fc725d286049a0dd39f07a0e-refs/branch-heads/6423@{#1}
OS : Mac Arm (14.3 beta, 13.5 Beta, 11.4,13.4), Mac Intel(10.15.7), Linux
** Prerequisites (flags on/off) - None
Steps to reproduce : 1. Launch chrome and sign in 2. Open Bookmark and pin 3. Exit full screen and open NTP 4. Click on customize screen button 5. Observe Bookmark and edit button overlap in right topmost corner
Observed results: Bookmark and edit button overlapped
Expected Result : Bookmark and edit button should not overlapped
Actual Result : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Wtj5pFjvt7vf_bJr0ZQuEp5TDXKQckF1/view?usp=sharing
Expected Result: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PbmztvAQSHIyYDQpqDBWWKePN3q_JyGu/view?usp=sharing
Good Build: 125.0.6421.0 Bad Build: 125.0.6422.0
You are probably looking for a change made after 1287555 (known good), but no later than 1287556 (first known bad). CHANGELOG URL: The script might not always return single CL as suspect as some perf builds might get missing due to failure. https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/b0aa162109191a601d7a0a886b0722af7e74619c..f72986bd388a9411308720299bc59762f48a6330
Suspect: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/b0aa162109191a601d7a0a886b0722af7e74619c..f72986bd388a9411308720299bc59762f48a6330
@Caroline: Could you please check whether this is caused with respect to your change, if not please help us in assigning it to the right owner.
Note: 1. Issue able to repro on latest Canary #125.0.6423.0 , Beta #125.0.6422.4, 2. Issue unable to repro on latest Dev #125.0.6420.4 and Stable #124.0.6367.62 3. Issue not repro on Win(10,11)
Thank You..!!

entry.title: [css-contain-3][css-color-5] Style queries do not work when testing a value from light-dark function
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open a test case (https://codepen.io/kizu/pen/zYXLppE, or an attached .html) 2. Look at the elements with the dark background and green text.
or
1. In CSS, register some custom property with the `<color>` syntax. 2. On some element, assign a value to this custom property via `light-dark()` function. 3. Apply a container style query for this property and attempt to apply styles to this element's children based on it.
# Problem Description In Chrome (stable, and Canary), the container style query does not match for the registered custom property that uses `light-dark()`. In Safari Technology Preview (the only other browser that currently supports container style queries) this works as expected.
# Additional Comments This does not work in Firefox, as it does not yet support container style queries, but works in Safari TP.
Note that in Safari TP, it is required to have the custom property be registered in order for it to work. This feature could be very useful for testing the currently applied color with container style queries, as it will, essentially, allow using `light-dark()` and them to detect the color scheme on an element scope.
# Summary [css-contain-3][css-color-5] Style queries do not work when testing a value from light-dark function
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>CSS
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Canary \ Regression: No

entry.title: Abnormal width when using "flex-wrap: wrap", "width: max-content" and "column-gap" at the same time
Pointer event property 'isPrimary' is lost after some writing with pen
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem Visit this sample: https://willtech.wacom.com/web-issues/chrome/isPrimary.html
Example used the following text as input:
"Amouage is a High Perfumery House renowned for creating some of the most finely crafted perfumes in the world. Founded in the Sultanate of Oman in 1983 by the Albusaidi family to be ‘The Gift of Kings’, the House has redefined the Arabian art of perfumery and garnered a global reputation for bringing innovative modernity and true artistry to all its creations. The chairman of the board is Sayyid Khalid, who succeeded the founding chairman his brother Sayyid Badr in 2003."
It could be needed more text to be written to experience the problem.
# Problem Description Problem is observed under Windows. Write with pen device, for example used Lenovo ThinkPad X13 Yoga Gen.1 on Windows 11. Write some text, sometime more, sometimes less, pointer event begins to report isPrimary property as false.
# Summary Pointer event property 'isPrimary' is lost after some writing with pen
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: The chrome zoom and css zoom features work slightly differently when they should work the same.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a simple web page with css zoom to 80%, inspect window.innerHeight and window.innerWidth 2. Create a simple web with no css zoom, apply zoom in the browser to 80%, inspect window.innerHeight and window.innerWidth 3. The web with browser zoom has a viewport 25% bigger with is correct to make center and other calculations, the web with css zoom has the original viewport size unchanged, this breaks calculations in some third party themes we use.
# Problem Description I think I have found a problem with css zoom in chrome, if you apply the zoom from the browser, 80% for example, the window.innerHeigh and window.innerWidth grows by 25% which makes absolute position calculations (width and height based) works correctly.
If you apply the 80% zoom with css, html {zoom: 80%}, almost everything works perfectly and the appearance is the same as applying the zoom from the browser, but window.innerHeigh and window.innerWidth do not adjust to the new size so any calculations with these values are not done correctly.
Can this behavior be fixed somehow? I need the zoom by css to work the same as the one provided by chrome so that everything works the same.
# Additional Comments The problem is that we need a web application to be viewed at 80% zoom by default (without user intervention), but the third-party theme we use does not calculate certain positions well because it does not have the correct size when zoomed by css.
# Summary The chrome zoom and css zoom features work slightly differently when they should work the same.
# Custom Questions #### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Memory graphs are not shown when profiling is done after enabling the memory checkbox in DevTools
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 126.0.6423.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) f2983f361cae3033fc725d286049a0dd39f07a0e-refs/branch-heads/6423@{#1}
OS : Mac,Win(10,11),Linux
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and open any website (ex: wikipedia.org) 2. Open DevTools and click on Performance tab 3. Click on the Memory checkbox 4. Click on reload button 5. Observe that the memory graphs are not shown (can be seen again after clicking on memory checkbox twice)
Actual Result: Memory graphs are not shown when profiling is done after enabling the memory checkbox
Expected Result: Memory graphs must be shown
This issue exists from M-114 onwards .So, raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the screencast attached
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Beta #125.0.6422.4, Dev #125.0.6420.4 and Stable #124.0.6367.61 2)As this is a Non-Regression issue, changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.content:

entry.content:
re. https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/9c9276619d5c75eb7c3f74fc89d052888f8c7b81
This patch has been identified as causing a statistically significant regression to the competitive benchmark Speedometer 3.
The pinpoint run https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/140758d1be0000 gives high confidence this patch is responsible for the regression. Please treat this as you would a unit test failure and resolve the issue promptly. More information on the policy can be found at https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/benchmark_performance_regressions.md

entry.title: [📍] Question: Is there any way (or any point) in "warming up" Pinpoint builds?
entry.content:
# Premise
* Our team runs quite a lot of Pinpoint jobs, esp. on Chromium's competitive benchmarks.
* I've got a [preset that fires three jobs at once](https://user.git.corp.google.com/kdlee/2024-01-30-pinpoint-batching/+/02ab520d3723e1e0267acc5fac9c669656557d81/pinpoint-presets.yaml) (Google-internal).
* There's always a long process in running this many benchmarks for this many repetitions.
# Question
* Is there any way to cut down on the build time spent on such jobs?
* For example, if I copied the GN args exactly of the builder, and then built the `performance_test_suite` target locally on my workstation, is it possible to "warm up" reclient s.t. the subsequent Pinpoint job gets 100% cache hits and builds instantaneously?
I'm asking this under the assumption that build time also counts against queuing time on Pinpoint - but please LMK if that's not the case.

entry.title: Compilation failure when passing @JniType("std::vector") Object[] as an argument from Java to Native
Add feature: unhide tab group
entry.content:
Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: (e.g. Win10, MacOS 10.12, etc...)
Note: Chrome is not responsible for bugs or behavior of individual extensions.
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) create a group of tabs, save the group (2) hide the group (3) try to unhide the group from the right click group tab menu
What is the expected result? within the drop down menu, there should be an option to unhide hidden tab groups.
What happens instead? there is no option to unhide, and I cannot figure out how to refind the tab group I hid
Does this issue affect a publicly-available extension? If so, please include its ID here. no
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.

entry.title: "Ignore allocated bitrate during initial exponential BWE." should be done behind an experiment
entry.content:
The change "Ignore allocated bitrate during initial exponential BWE." https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/346760 was intended to only have an effect behind an experiment. Due to a bug in the cl, the change still change behavior even without an experiment.
The offending cl was reverted in https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/347622
I am requesting permission to merge the revert into M125. (https://webrtc.googlesource.com/src.git/+log/refs/branch-heads/6422)

entry.title: Renderer Fallback Task Error on Visual Studio Code during Automation Testing on Microsoft Edge Version 123.0.2420.97 (Official build) (64-bit)
entry.content:
Description The occurrence of the fallback_task_provider.cc(126) error indicates a failure in the renderer task provisioning system when running automation testing on Facebook using Microsoft Edge in Visual Studio Code.
Steps to Reproduce: Environment Setup Windows 11. Browser: Microsoft Edge. Visual Studio Code: Version 1.88.1. Selenium WebDriver: Edge WebDriver:
Project Configuration: Open Visual Studio Code. Prepare a Selenium project configured to use the Edge WebDriver. Ensure the Selenium code is aimed to open and interact with http://facebook.com.
Running Script: Execute the Selenium script through the terminal in Visual Studio Code. Observe that the terminal displays the output DevTools listening on ws://127.0.0.1:64694/devtools/browser/eba9c4ec-9f85-43c3-80b6-0009436a0958.
Error Occurrence:
After the script runs, note that the terminal displays the error: [15476:1084:0417/105836.739:ERROR:fallback_task_provider.cc(126)] Every renderer should have at least one task provided by a primary task provider. If a "Renderer" fallback task is shown, it is a bug. If you have repro steps, please file a new bug and tag it as a dependency of crbug.com/739782.
Error Documentation
Expected Outcome: The Selenium script should execute automation testing on Microsoft Edge without generating errors related to the renderer or task provider.
Observed Outcome:: An error in the renderer indicates a failure in task provisioning, which should not occur.
Additional Information: The error occurs every time the script is run.

entry.title: Change FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl::DidCopyFrame to receive frame and metadata separately
entry.content:
Currently FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl::DidCopyFrame may receive an empty frame, which will be forwarded to FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl::MaybeDeliverFrame, where TRACE_EVENT_END for the capture event of the frame will be logged [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/viz/service/frame_sinks/video_capture/frame_sink_video_capturer_impl.cc;l=1473;drc=a0455fc90ed301766d96c0a38f2006ebf5416f3c).
Thus, if the frame copy fails, there will be no way to log a TRACE_EVENT_END for that frame. To fix that, some frame identifier, like a reference_time or whole metadata, should be always passed to DidCopyFrame(), forwarded to MaybeDeliverFrame(), and used in TRACE_EVENT_END, even if there's no frame.
